clinical_study.brief_title: To Investigate the Bone and Muscle Abnormalities in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease With MRI
clinical_study.official_title: To Investigate the Bone and Muscle Abnormalities in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease Compared to Healthy Volunteers With MRI

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) have a higher risk of fractures than those without. The purpose of this study is to develop a non-invasive Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) method that can improve fracture risk prediction and provide early diagnosis for bone abnormalities in patients with CKD.

detailed_description.textblock:
Chronic Kidney Disease-Mineral and Bone Disorder (MBD） is a common complication of chronic kidney disease (CKD), which may lead to defective mineralization, altered bone morphology, and/or bone turnover. Animal research found that bone changes occur even in the early stage of CKD , and with CKD progression, the patient may show symptoms such as bone pain, joint pain, bone deformation, and even spontaneous fractures.
Despite significant advances in understanding bone disease in CKD, most clinical and biochemical targets used in clinical practice remain controversial, resulting in an undermanagement of bone fragility.Our ability to diagnose CKD-MBD and to initiate strategies that could prevent fractures remains limited by the lack of accurate and noninvasive diagnostic tools.
The purpose of this study is to develop a non-invasive method that can improve fracture risk prediction and provide early diagnosis for bone abnormalities in patients with CKD.

primary_outcome.measure: Magnetic resonance examination for general diagnosis：routine imaging sequences
primary_outcome.description: All MRI imaging was performed on a clinical 3.0 T General Electric(GE) MR scanner on the lumbar spine and lower legs of both experimental group and control group.

primary_outcome.measure: Magnetic resonance examination to measure tissue diffusion and perfusion：DWI-related sequence
primary_outcome.description: All MRI imaging was performed on a clinical 3.0 T General Electric(GE) MR scanner on the lumbar spine and lower legs of both experimental group and control group.And the full abbreviation of the above sequence:Diffusion Weighted Imaging(DWI)-related sequence

primary_outcome.measure: Magnetic resonance examination to measure material changes in tissue：CEST
primary_outcome.description: All MRI imaging was performed on a clinical 3.0 T General Electric(GE) MR scanner on the lumbar spine and lower legs of both experimental group and control group.And the full abbreviation of the above sequence: chemical exchange saturation transfer(CEST)

primary_outcome.measure: Magnetic resonance examination to measure the fat content of tissues：IDEAL- IQ
primary_outcome.description: All MRI imaging was performed on a clinical 3.0 T General Electric(GE) MR scanner on the lumbar spine and lower legs of both experimental group and control group.And the full abbreviation of the above sequence：iterative decomposition of water and fat with echo asymmetry and least-squares estimation (IDEAL) - intelligent quantification (IQ)

primary_outcome.measure: Magnetic resonance examination with ultrashort echo time to imaging musculoskeletal ：UTE
primary_outcome.description: All MRI imaging was performed on a clinical 3.0 T General Electric(GE) MR scanner on the lumbar spine and lower legs of both experimental group and control group. And the full abbreviation of the above sequence: ultrashort echo time (UTE)

primary_outcome.measure: Magnetic resonance examination for bone morphological observation: ZTE
primary_outcome.description: All MRI imaging was performed on a clinical 3.0 T General Electric(GE) MR scanner on the lower legs of both experimental group and control group.And the full abbreviation of the above sequence: Zero-Echo Time(ZTE)

primary_outcome.measure: Magnetic resonance examination to measure changes in the relaxation rate of muscles and blood vessels: SWI
primary_outcome.description: All MRI imaging was performed on a clinical 3.0 T General Electric(GE) MR scanner on the lower legs of both experimental group and control group. And the full abbreviation of the above sequence: Susceptibility-weighted Imaging(SWI)
The dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) was performed on the lumbar spine of both experimental group and control group.

primary_outcome.measure: Blood biochemistry ：Routine blood was used to detect anemia
primary_outcome.description: Routine blood samples were collected from individuals in the experimental group

primary_outcome.measure: Blood biochemistry ：renal function was used for staging CKD
primary_outcome.description: Renal function samples were collected from individuals in the experimental group and control group

primary_outcome.measure: Blood biochemistry ：Serum electrolyte was used to detect electrolyte changes
primary_outcome.description: Serum electrolyte samples were collected from individuals in the experimental group

primary_outcome.measure: Blood biochemistry ：the ALP、PTH、25-OH VitD、osteocalcin、T-P1NP and β-CTX were used to detect bone metabolism
primary_outcome.description: The above serum samples were collected from individuals in the experimental group

primary_outcome.measure: Blood biochemistry ： blood glucose was used to determine the presence or absence of diabetes
primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose samples were collected from individuals in the experimental group

primary_outcome.measure: Blood biochemistry ：CK(Creatine kinase) was used to detect muscle lesions
primary_outcome.description: CK samples were collected from individuals in the experimental group

primary_outcome.measure: The urine routine was examined to determine whether individuals in the control group and the experimental group had hematuria and proteinuria
primary_outcome.description: The Routine urine samples were collected from individuals in the experimental group and control group

clinical_study.condition: Chronic Kidney Disease-Mineral and Bone Disorder

intervention.description: Bone mineral density was examined in all cases and controls

study_pop.textblock: Subject group:Hospitalized patients in department of Nephrology, Tongji Hospital, Qiaokou District, Wuhan, Hubei, China control group:social recruitment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
CKD patients aged 18-70 years with free movement
-
Exclusion Criteria:
1. The following diseases: rickets, osteomalacia, Paget's disease, acromegaly, scurvy (vitamin C deficiency), hyperthyroidism, history of malignant tumors, received radiotherapy and chemotherapy, fractures within 6 months, lumbar and calf trauma surgery, scoliosis, rheumatic immunity disease, anorexia nervosa, motor neuron disease
2. Treated with the following drugs within two years:
A) Bisphosphonates: Alendronate , etidronate , Ibandronate, rithiadronate, and zoledronate B) Steroid hormones: estrogen replacement agents , isoflavone derivatives , estrogen, progesterone C) Oral glucocorticoids: prednisone , Prednisone D) Salmon calcitonin
3. MRI contraindications: Intra Uterine Device(iUD), pacemaker, cochlear implant, claustrophobia, etc -

condition_browse.mesh_term: Chronic Kidney Disease-Mineral and Bone Disorder
